Package pl.bristleback.server.bristle.security.exception

  • Exception Summary 
    Exception Description
    AuthorizationException
    This exception is thrown when user doesn't have one or more rights required in secured action.
    BristleSecurityException
    Base Bristleback Security System exception, extended by more precise exceptions.
    InactiveUserException
    This simple exception wraps all situations when username and password are correct but authentication process cannot be completed because of one of the following issues: user account is locked (userDetails.isAccountNonLocked() returns false) user account has expired (userDetails.isAccountNonExpired() returns false) user account is not enabled (userDetails.isEnabled() returns false) user credentials have expired (userDetails.isCredentialsNonExpired() returns false)

    Created on: 23.02.13 08:44

    IncorrectUsernameOrPasswordException
    Exception thrown when user with given name cannot be found or password for that user is not valid.
    UserAlreadyAuthenticatedException
    This exception is thrown when single connection tries to authenticate but there is still valid authentication assigned to this connection.
    UserNotAuthenticatedException
    This exception is thrown whenever application or authentication system want to retrieve authentication object assigned to active user connection and that authentication cannot be found or is no longer valid (UserAuthentication.isValid() returns false).
